author: nicolas.alhaddad
content: If the secret shares and the secret are computed in a binary field of order q,  one can still commit to them in an elliptic curve of order q (the fields are isomorphic).

author: .vbuterin
content: right, but an elliptic curve of order `2**k` is itself not secure

author: nicolas.alhaddad
content: Not sure if the statement you are making works for all k. I know if k is composite, sometimes there might be intermediate fields which can be used to speed up computation (That same speed up might make computing discrete log easier). But If k is prime we should be ok no?
